subject: Art & Design
title: Serif Fonts: The Classic Workhorses
description: A short lesson to help you apply Serif Fonts: The Classic Workhorses.

hook.text: Those tiny feet at the ends of letters in Times New Roman? They're called serifs.

buildup.text: Serifs originated in Roman stone carving. Chisels naturally created small finishing strokes.

discovery.text: In print, serifs guide the eye along lines of text. That's why books and newspapers use them.

twist.text: The claim that serifs improve reading speed is debated. Context matters more than the serifs themselves.

climax.text: Sub-categories include Old Style (Garamond), Transitional (Baskerville), and Modern (Didot).

punchline.text: Serifs aren't decoration. They're 2,000 years of evolution.
